page.title: 01Hills North of Clun
page.content: This is a hilly area, rising from 600' to 1300'. The soil is fertile old red sandstone and arable crops, grass and deciduous trees are growing over almost the entire area. There is some Forestry Commission coniferous forest in the North East Corner. The main occupation is mixed farming, with three farms dominating the area, namely Bicton, Guilden Down and Llanhedric. The grazing livestock are single suckled beef cows and sheep producing fat lambs. As the soil is so fertile about 25% of the land area is used to grow arable crops, predominantly cereals. This part of South West Shropshire has changed very little over the years and is much the same in the 1980s as it was 50 years ago. For this reason and being an area of outstanding natural beauty many visitors come to enjoy the peace
